lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.controller

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.controller.AbstractController
      • lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.controller.UserController

  • public class UserController
extends AbstractController
    The user controller deals with any functions to do with users in the system. This includes coordinator creation, logging on, coordinator deletion and son on. It extends the AbstractController to handle checking of Dt information is correct

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ActProxyAuthenticatedImpl _auth
      Parameter that has a ProxyActor that allows actors to do functions on the server.
      private Server server
      Parameter that allows the system to gain server access, the server function lives in the model of the client and has RMI calls to access the server.
      private static UserController singleton
      The property field that will generate the singelton, it could throw an ExceptionInInitializerError if the server is offline.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private UserController()
      Allows creation of a usercontroller, it's made private to force users to utilise the singleton form of it and prevent their being more than one type created.

    • Field Detail

      • server

        private Server server
        Parameter that allows the system to gain server access, the server function lives in the model of the client and has RMI calls to access the server.

      • _auth

        private ActProxyAuthenticatedImpl _auth
        Parameter that has a ProxyActor that allows actors to do functions on the server. These are functions that require users to be logged in to perform, like the addCoordinator. It will be set at moment of login

      • singleton

        private static UserController singleton
        The property field that will generate the singelton, it could throw an ExceptionInInitializerError if the server is offline.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserController

        private UserController()
                throws ServerOfflineException,
                       ServerNotBoundException
        Allows creation of a usercontroller, it's made private to force users to utilise the singleton form of it and prevent their being more than one type created.
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - is an error that is thrown when the server is offline or not reachable
        ServerNotBoundException - is only thrown when attempting to access a server which has no current binding. This shouldn't happen, but you never know!

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static UserController getInstance()
        Gets the singleton instance of the usercontroller in the system.
        Returns:
        returns the instance of the usercontroller

      • oeLogin

        public lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.java.types.stdlib.PtBoolean oeLogin(java.lang.String login,
                                                                                      java.lang.String password)
                                                                               throws ServerOfflineException,
                                                                                      ServerNotBoundException,
                                                                                      IncorrectFormatException
        Allows a user to logon to the server, if the server confirms access is allowed, the method will return a PtBoolean of true.
        Parameters:
        login - A string of the username to login with
        password - A string of the password to login with
        Returns:
        Returns a PtBoolean of true if the user was logged in by the server, otherwise will return false
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - is an error that is thrown when the server is offline or not reachable
        ServerNotBoundException - is only thrown when attempting to access a server which has no current binding. This shouldn't happen, but you never know!
        IncorrectFormatException - is thrown when a Dt/Et information type does not match the is() method specified in the specification

      • oeLogout

        public lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.java.types.stdlib.PtBoolean oeLogout()
                                                                                throws ServerOfflineException,
                                                                                       ServerNotBoundException
        Allows a user to logout from the server, if the server confirms the logout was successful the method will return a PtBoolean of true.
        Returns:
        Returns a PtBoolean of true if the user was logged out by the server, otherwise will return false
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - is an error that is thrown when the server is offline or not reachable
        ServerNotBoundException - is only thrown when attempting to access a server which has no current binding. This shouldn't happen, but you never know!

      • getUserType

        public ActProxyAuthenticatedImpl.UserType getUserType()
        Gets the type of user that is currently logged on. Should return either a coordinator or a administrator if logged on and a authenticated if no-one is logged on
        Returns:
        Returns an enum of type UserType, found in the class ActProxyAuthenticatedImpl

      • oeAddCoordinator

        public lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.java.types.stdlib.PtBoolean oeAddCoordinator(java.lang.String coordinatorID,
                                                                                               java.lang.String login,
                                                                                               java.lang.String password)
                                                                                        throws ServerOfflineException,
                                                                                               ServerNotBoundException,
                                                                                               IncorrectFormatException
        If an administrator is logged in, will send an addCoordinator request to the server. If successful, it will return a PtBoolean of true
        Parameters:
        coordinatorID - The ID of the coordinator to create, the user specifies the ID, not the system in the creation process
        login - The logon of the user to create. This is the username they will use at point of logon at the client front end
        password - The password of the user to create. This is the password they will use at point of logon at the client front end
        Returns:
        Returns a PtBoolean true if the user was created, otherwise will return false
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - is an error that is thrown when the server is offline or not reachable
        ServerNotBoundException - is only thrown when attempting to access a server which has no current binding. This shouldn't happen, but you never know!
        IncorrectFormatException - is thrown when a Dt/Et information type does not match the is() method specified in the specification

      • oeDeleteCoordinator

        public lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.java.types.stdlib.PtBoolean oeDeleteCoordinator(java.lang.String coordinatorID)
                                                                                           throws ServerOfflineException,
                                                                                                  ServerNotBoundException,
                                                                                                  IncorrectFormatException
        If an administrator is logged in, will send a deleteCoordinator request to the server. If successful, it will return a PtBoolean of true
        Parameters:
        coordinatorID - The ID of the coordinator to delete
        Returns:
        Returns a PtBoolean true if the user was deleted, otherwise will return false
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - is an error that is thrown when the server is offline or not reachable
        ServerNotBoundException - is only thrown when attempting to access a server which has no current binding. This shouldn't happen, but you never know!
        IncorrectFormatException - is thrown when a Dt/Et information type does not match the is() method specified in the specification

      • oeUpdateCoordinator

        public lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.java.types.stdlib.PtBoolean oeUpdateCoordinator(java.lang.String coordinatorID,
                                                                                                  java.lang.String login,
                                                                                                  java.lang.String password)
                                                                                           throws ServerOfflineException,
                                                                                                  ServerNotBoundException,
                                                                                                  IncorrectFormatException
        If an administrator is logged in, will send an updateCoordinator request to the server. If successful, it will return a PtBoolean of true
        Parameters:
        coordinatorID - The ID of the coordinator to update, this is a non changeable field and is used to know which user to update
        login - The logon of the user to update to. This is the username they will use at point of logon at the client front end
        password - The password of the user to update to. This is the password they will use at point of logon at the client front end
        Returns:
        Returns a PtBoolean true if the user was updated, otherwise will return false
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - is an error that is thrown when the server is offline or not reachable
        ServerNotBoundException - is only thrown when attempting to access a server which has no current binding. This shouldn't happen, but you never know!
        IncorrectFormatException - is thrown when a Dt/Et information type does not match the is() method specified in the specification

                                                                                                                           throws ServerOfflineException,
                                                                                                                                  ServerNotBoundException
        Gets an ArrayList of all CtCoordinators in the system.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of all CtCoordinators from the server
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - is an error that is thrown when the server is offline or not reachable
        ServerNotBoundException - is only thrown when attempting to access a server which has no current binding. This shouldn't happen, but you never know!

      • getMessagesForUser

        public java.util.ArrayList<lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.java.system.types.design.DtMessage> getMessagesForUser()
                                                                                                                      throws ServerOfflineException,
                                                                                                                             ServerNotBoundException
        Returns a list of messages for the current user that is logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of type DtMessage, which contains the messages sent for the current user logged in
        Throws:
        ServerOfflineException - is an error that is thrown when the server is offline or not reachable
        ServerNotBoundException - is only thrown when attempting to access a server which has no current binding. This shouldn't happen, but you never know!

      • getAuth

        public ActProxyAuthenticatedImpl getAuth()
        Returns the ActProxyAuthenticated user, which is used to call methods that only a logged in user should be able to do. The user will need casting first, so use instanceof to confirm user type
        Returns:
        Returns an implemented ActProxyAuthenticated user type, that can be used to call methods that the user has done. An example is oeHandleCrisis
